titleStmt.title: A key to the Kings cabinet; or Animadversions upon the three printed speeches, of Mr Lisle, Mr Tate, and Mr Browne, spoken at a common-hall in London, 3. July, 1645. Detecting the malice and falshood of their blasphemous observations made upon the King and Queenes letters.
titleStmt.author: Browne, Thomas, 1604?-1673.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Leonard Lichfield, printer to the University,

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Lisle, John, et al. Three speeches spoken at a common-hall.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
